meanings.definition: The quality or state of being anisotropic.
meanings.sent1: The anisotropism of the crystal made it refract light in unique ways.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the anisotropism of the material to understand its behavior under stress.
meanings.sent3: The anisotropism of the fabric caused the stripes to look wavy when stretched.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity had an anisotropism that allowed her to see things from different angles.
meanings.sent5: The anisotropism of the diamond made it sparkle differently from every angle.

meanings.definition: The property of exhibiting different physical properties in different directions.
meanings.sent1: The anisotropism of the wood affected its strength depending on the grain direction.
meanings.sent2: Engineers considered the anisotropism of the material when designing the structure.
meanings.sent3: The anisotropism of the magnet made it behave strangely near the poles.
meanings.sent4: The anisotropism of her personality meant she reacted differently to various situations.
meanings.sent5: The anisotropism of the crystal clear water revealed the hidden depths below.
